etymology.description: Depicts a man with the neck in shackles -> borrowed to represent 央 (yāng, 'center')
etymology.interpretation: The character originally depicted a man in shackles. It was later borrowed into use as a phonetic loan for 央 (yāng, 'center'). Although Shuowen suggests it represents a person inside a house, this later interpretation aligns with the semantic shift, not the original etymology.

examples.chinese: 图书馆位于校园央(圖書館位於校園央)，吸引了无数学子(吸引了無數學子)。
examples.pinyin: Túshūguǎn wèiyú xiàoyuán yāng, xīyǐnle wúshù xuézǐ.
examples.english: The library is located at the center of the campus, attracting countless students.

examples.chinese: 商场位于城市央(商場位於城市央)。
examples.english: The shopping mall is at the center of the city.
